other_tests.findings: Clear cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) with a white-cell count of 20 per cubic millimeter (85% neutrophils, 6% lymphocytes, and 9% monocytes), a red-cell count of 16 per cubic millimeter, a glucose level of 68 mg per deciliter, and a protein level of 44 mg per deciliter.
other_tests.changes_over_time: A repeat lumbar puncture showed clear CSF with a white-cell count of 17 per cubic millimeter (70% lymphocytes), a red-cell count of 303 per cubic millimeter, a glucose level of 60 mg per deciliter, and a protein level of 102 mg per deciliter, indicating a shift from neutrophilic predominance to lymphocytic predominance.

other_tests.findings: Lymphocytic inflammatory process and the presence of HSV-infected cells on immunohistochemical staining; no evidence of cancer.
Findings consistent with diffuse encephalopathy without focal or epileptiform features.
